description: Sets the program to use the numerical formulation for large-strain deformation. The default is off. See the section 'Large- and Small-Strain Modes' for discussion of the additional calculations done in this formulation.
notes: Large-strain mode performs additional calculations for large deformations
Should be enabled when expecting significant deformations or rotations
May affect computational performance due to additional calculations
Must be set before cycling if large strains are anticipated
Small-strain mode is sufficient for most problems with limited deformation
See documentation section 'Large- and Small-Strain Modes' for detailed discussion

examples.description: Enable large-strain mode for problems with significant deformation
Disable large-strain mode (use small-strain formulation - default)

examples.command:
model large-strain on
model domain extent -10 10
ball generate number 1000 radius 0.5
model gravity 9.81
model cycle 10000
examples.description: Enable large-strain before setup for granular flow simulation

examples.command:
model large-strain on
; ... setup model ...
model solve

python_sdk_alternative.workaround: itasca.command('model large-strain on') or itasca.command('model large-strain off') - Python SDK does not provide direct large-strain control
